column4: it would be useful to learn about it, chmod is really important to understand
if it is working, what might be wrong, is drive mania working now?
i would say that is fine then
a lot of programs would require sudo to run, especially something that sounds like it does something with drives...?
does the game load now? with sudo?.. i guess just use sudo, not that big of a deal?
to install yes, to move depends no the chmod
From my understanding a .sh is generally a script that if it does much of anything, will always need you to run it as root or (sudo)
you could cat the .sh first and you would know where it wants to be
: since im doing this manually will i also need to use CHmod then ?
yea i know how that is, enjoy the ride with *nix
: so if  i understand, chmod is simply permission administration ?
this could be why you are having to use sudo all the time
lol, well you made a good choice, *nix is wayyy better for servers, pretty darn good for workstations
: i started BBS'ing, and admining my own system at around 12 years old :p
